title: Gallatin Valley Bicycle Club Training Ride Series
flyer_url: Gallatin Valley Bicycle Club Training Ride Series.pdf

title: Highlands Cycling Road Race & Time Trial
Thompson Park Mtn Bike Race
course: 7.3 mile figure 8 course, 60% double track, 40% single track.
registration:
On-line by Sports Base Online 20$-  Juniors Free
Race day registration available 25$
Registration time 10:00 to 10:45
One day licenses will be available
notes:
Race start time 11:00 Pro/semi-pro/expert men 3 laps
11:00 Pro/semi-pro/expert women  3 laps
11:05 Sport men 2 laps
11:05 sport women 2 laps
11:10 sport juniors  2 laps
11:15 beginner men 1 lap
11:15 beginner women 1 lap
11:20 beginner juniors 1 lap
directions: Take Harrison Avenue exit (Exit 127A) south on Harrison Avenue for 2.9 miles.  At the intersection of State Route 2 and Harrison Avenue, turn left (southeast) for approximaltely 4-miles. Signs will mark the turn off to Thompson Park on the right side of the road (right turn).

title: Woodland Cross Race
description: Lone Pine \\\'Cross Hosted By Sportsman & Ski Haus  OCtober 27th 2007 @ Lone Pine State Park.
course: The course is fast and spectator-friendly, and includes a combination of buffed single-track, dirt roads, asphalt, tight turns, sand, and a few run-ups/hills.
registration: www.SportsBaseOnline.com; $25 race day registration is from 9:30-11:00 a.m.  First race begins at 11:30.  Juniors who are MBRA members- registration is free; $10 for others.
directions:
From downtown Kalispell at the intersection of HWY 2 and HWY 93:
Head west on HWY 2 to Meridian Road- just past Albertsons
Take left on Meridian, go through 3 stop signs, and continue out of town and up a 1-mile hill (Foys Lake Road)
About  mile past the top of the hill, take a left at signs for Lone Pine State Park- follow to 
end of the road.
